name: DemoStashCan
0:
”Alexa tell Demo Stash Can to unlock.”
”Alexa tell Demo Stash Can to change color.”
”Alexa launch Demo Stash Can.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: demo stash can
Developer Terms of Use
des:
To use this skill, you must:
 - have an Arx Labs StashCan
 - link your personal Alexa profile (with "Personalize Skills" enabled) to your Arx Labs account 
 To enable Personalize Skills see below.

With this skill, you can use voice to:
1. Unlock your StashCan device.
Example: "Alexa, tell Demo StashCan to unlock"
2. Change the appearance of the LED ring.
 Examples:
- "Alexa, ask Demo StashCan to change color to red"
- "Alexa, tell Demo StashCan to change style to solid night"
- "Alexa, tell Demo StashCan to set brightness to five percent"
3. Change the access time of an unlock (changes the time allowed for removing the lid).
Example: "Alexa, tell Demo StashCan to change access time to 10 seconds"
4. Request information on usage of the skill.
Examples:
- "Alexa, ask Demo StashCan for help"
- "Alexa, ask Demo StashCan for color choices"

To create a voice profile, visit your profile in the settings menu of the Alexa App, or say "Alexa, learn my voice" and you will be prompted to create a profile.

Afer enabling the skill in the Alexa app, you will be prompted to link your account with the Arx Labs account. Linking will automatically redirect you to the Arx Labs login page. Use the email address you used when you registered your StashCan. During this process, you will be required to create a four digit voice pin code (although you will be given the option to opt out of using the pin code). You will then be sent to a page asking for permission for the skill to access your StashCan information.

If you wish to change your use of the voice pin code, visit https://login.lockedbrands.com/login/stashcan.

Once enabled, you can get started by saying "Alexa open Demo StashCan" and you will hear a description of things you may say.

To enable "Personalize Skills" in the Alexa app, go to Settings> Your Profile> Voice> Voice Profile Settings > Personalize Skills and press the button
